text: HackerRank | Prepare Certify Compete Apply Search   1  All Contests SRBD Code Contest - 2024 (Round 1) Gain with Pain  Gain with Pain locked Problem Submissions Discussions Time Limit ++ Memory Limit MRBD (Muscle Research & Development Bangladesh) is a great place for software engineers to build muscles. One day Mr. Needle, a skinny software engineer comes to MRBD with the dream of a muscular body. There he meets the very famous trainer Mr. Stick. At ﬁrst, Stick explains to Needle that muscle development requires consistency in daily workouts, protein intake, and proper sleep. Then, he prepares a daily workout plan including types of exercises, types of exercises, types of exercises, type of exercise, and types of exercises. Each type of exercise consists of sets, and each set consists of repetitions. Needle has been following the workout plan for some days. Your task is to determine whether he is consistent or not. Note. To be consistent, Needle has to follow the Stick's instructions daily. Input Format The ﬁrst line of the input contains a single integer - the number of test cases. The ﬁrst line of each test case contains an integer - number of days. The ﬁrst line of each days contains exercise. The second line of each days contains exercise. The Third line of each days contains exercise. The Fourth line of each days contains exercise. The Fifth line of each days contains exercise. For each type of exercise you will be given , , and respectively number of exercise he perfomed for that body part, number of sets he perfomed for each exercise, and number of repetitions he performed in each set. Constraints It is guaranteed that the sum of will not exceed . Output Format For each test case print whether the Needle was consistent with his training routine during these days. If he was consistent print "Consistent", otherwise print "Inconsistent".
